Events

Follow the City of Ballarat :
Listen

Contact : Events Calendar
P. 03 5320 5500

  • Information
  • Annual Events
  • Public Holdiays

Add Your Event! to the City of Ballarat online calendar.

Ballarat hosts a huge number of events and festivals throughout the year which celebrate the best of the region. Visitors from around the nation gather to enjoy Ballarat's famous hospitality, arts and culture, beautiful gardens, historic buildings and fascinating heritage.  

Whats On.

For Auld Lang Syne at the Art Gallery of Ballarat
Art Gallery of Ballarat 40 Lydiard Street North Ballarat VIC 3350
Fri, Apr 11, 2014 12:00 AM - Sun, Jul 27, 2014 11:59 PM
Celebrate the role played by Scots in development of the Australian nation from the First Fleet to Federation at Australia's oldest and largest regional gallery.
Contact : Emily Osmond
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
Spectacular Saturn - School Holiday Program
Ballarat Observatory 439 Cobden St Entry from Magpie St
Tue, Jul 1, 2014 04:00 PM - Sat, Jul 12, 2014 07:00 PM
SATURN - Strap yourself in and take a spectacular journey into our solar system to visit Saturn.
View Saturn through a telescope, and see the beautiful rings. Activities for children, and 3D Movies.

Bookings essential on 03 5332 7526
Contact : Judith Bailey
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
Community Sports Camps Football and Netball Clinics
Alfredton Oval, Cuthberts Road, Alfredton
Wed, Jul 2, 2014 12:00 AM - Wed, Jul 2, 2014 11:59 PM
Community Sports Camps is holding a one day football and netball program for primary school aged children on the 2nd of July. Held at Alfredton Oval you can have an entire day filled with either netball or football.

- Great chance to improve skills, have fun and make new friends
- Qualified & enthusiastic coaches
- Morning & afternoon tea provided
- Giveaways & prizes to all participants

To register head to www.communitycamps.com.au or call 1300 562 571.
Contact : Community Sports Camps
Website Email Tweet Event! 
School Holiday Pottery Class – Clay Thongs
ClayMotion 37Tierneys Rd, Dunnstown 3352
Wed, Jul 2, 2014 02:00 PM - Wed, Jul 2, 2014 04:00 PM
School Holiday Program – Ballarat
CLAY THONGS

Wednesday 8th April 10-12noon $32.00 including materials and firing.

This project is a tactile project encouraging the children to ‘squelch’ their feet in the clay to make imprints for a set of clay thongs.

Children will roll out clay, imprint their feet into the soft clay, cut out the shape of their feet, and make their imprints into thongs.
LIMITED NUMBERS – ENROL ONLINE OR PHONE
Contact : Dawn WHitehand
Visit Facebook Page Email Tweet Event! 
Death In July festival
Musuem of Australian Democracy at Eureka Stawell Street South, Ballarat
Fri, Jul 4, 2014 06:00 PM - Sun, Jan 5, 2014 05:00 PM
Death In July festival is a celebration of Australian women’s crime writing to get your blood pumping!

A stellar line-up of authors will appear at the festival to speak on a fascinating range of topics including the CSI effect and YA crime writing. Guest writers include Leigh Redhead, Angela Savage, Honey Brown, Ellie Marney, Simmone Howell and many more.

The festival will be held at the Museum of Australian Democracy at Eureka across the weekend of 4 – 5 July, starting with a lovely launch evening on the Friday night featuring a keynote from guest author Angela Savage.
Contact : Sally Williams
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
School Holiday Pottery Class – Pencil Holder
ClayMotion 37Tierneys Rd, Dunnstown 3352
Wed, Jul 9, 2014 10:00 AM - Wed, Jul 9, 2014 12:00 PM
School Holiday Program- Ballarat
PENCIL HOLDERS pencil holder
Wednesday 16th April 2-4pm $32.00 including materials and firing.

Children will create the pencil holder by using the ‘pinching’ method. Techniques for modelling and joining clay will also be explored. The pencil holder will then be decorated by hand moulding additions, such as eyes and tails, and will then be painted using brightly coloured slips.

LIMITED NUMBERS: ENROL ONLINE OR PHONE
Contact : Dawn WHitehand
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
25th Eureka Arms and Militaria Fair
Wendouree Sports and Events Centre Norman St, Wendouree, Ballarat
Sat, Jul 12, 2014 09:00 AM - Sun, Jul 13, 2014 09:00 AM
Arms and Militaria Fair, 140 tables of dealers. Living history groups, Antique and modern arms, Medals, Books, Knives and swords, Hunting and shooting supplies, Collectable ammo, Uniforms, Optics, Onsite catering, family friendly event.
Contact : Nick Smith
Website Email Tweet Event! 
Alliance Française de Ballarat Bastille Day Dinner
G Place 102 English Street (off Grant Street)
Sat, Jul 12, 2014 07:00 PM - Sat, Jul 12, 2014 11:00 PM
Annual Dinner to celebrate all things French. Authentic French food by local chefs par excellence Lakitchen2u. Entertainment with a French flavour.
All welcome.
This is an event for the whole community and speaking French is welcome but entirely optional.
For details, please visit the AF website at http://afballarat.com.au.
Contact : Bernadette Brouwers
Website Email Tweet Event! 
Buninyong Pre - School - 50th Anniversary - Gala Ball
Buninyong Golf Club, Buninyong
Sat, Jul 12, 2014 07:30 PM - Sat, Jul 12, 2014 11:00 PM
To Celebrate 50 years of operations of the Buninyong Pre-School, we are holding a Gala Ball to celebrate. We would like all past families, teachers and students to attend as well the Buninyong Community. Tickets are $45, and can be purchased through Foundation Legal Buninyong or online at
https://www.stickytickets.com.au/17683

We have a local band (5 piece band) playing called Vinyl Tapp.

Your new memories can be captured in our photo booth, as well as a display of the past 50 years. Nibbles provided and drinks at Bar prices. Time 7.30 - 11.30pm
Contact : Prue Orchard
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
At Last: The Etta James Story
Her Majesty's 17 Lydiard Street, South Ballarat
Sat, Jul 12, 2014 08:00 PM - Sat, Jul 12, 2014 10:30 PM
Following a smash-hit national tour and back by popular demand the unforgETTAble sounds of Vika Bull and the Essential R & B Band will grace the stage of Her Majesty’s in Ballarat this July 12 to delight audiences with the story of one of the most influential soul singers of all times -Etta James.

At Last – The Etta James Story is a two-hour narrative concert starring Vika Bull. Vika brings her heart, soul and funk to tell the story of Etta’s turbulent life and sing her best loved songs including ‘Tell Mama,’, ‘Something’s Got A Hold On Me’, ‘Pushover’, the heartrending ‘I’d Rather Go Blind’, her iconic signature song ‘At Last’ and more. Vika Bull will be joined on stage by the sizzling hot The Essential R & B Band that will get you out of your seat and dancing in the aisles!
Contact : Lisa
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
From Africa WIth Love
Backspace Gallery Huyghue House, Alfred Deakin Place @Camp Street & Police Lane, Ballarat Vic 3350
Fri, Jul 18, 2014 06:00 PM - Sun, Jul 27, 2014 04:00 PM
From Africa With Love brings us photographs by Shanna Love that touch on the emotional bonds we feel toward animals whose destiny is by no means certain.

Opening event 18th July 6pm-8pm and continuing until Sunday 27th, open 12pm-4pm daily.

Free Admission

From Africa With Love also provides us with a window into the relationships between the animals themselves. Whether showing affection, or expressing anger or sadness, Shanna strives to capture images of her subjects that evoke emotions in us, as well.

Taking African wildlife photography beyond mere pictures of Hemingway’s Big Five, Love aims to have us read sentiment into her portraits, creating a strong connection that allows us to associate with the images on a personal level.

Since working with a conservation organisation, Shanna Love has become painfully aware of the dire situation that many of these amazing animals face through the myriad pressures of climate change, diminishing habitat, economic demands, political and social unrest.

From Africa With Love is her response to this: using an exhibition of her photographs to raise awareness of the rapid decline of many of the species seen here. While we will easily connect with her images on a visceral or aesthetic level, it is the data accompanying each image that drives the message home of how few of these magnificent beasts still survive in the wild.

Now an avid wildlife photographer, Shanna Love sees herself as both creating sumptuous images of exotic animals that speak to us through instinct, and fostering the will to protect the creatures she loves so well.

Contact : Shanna Love
Website Email Tweet Event! 
Writing workshop with Toni Jordan
Musuem of Australian Democracy at Eureka Stawell Street South, Ballarat
Sat, Jul 19, 2014 11:00 AM - Sat, Jul 19, 2014 01:00 PM
Ballarat Writers presents a writing workshop on dialogue with author Toni Jordan.

The workshop will cover: Why dialogue is not speech; How to transmit the boring things your characters say; What is subtext in dialogue, and why it matters; The art of minimalism in dialogue tags; Why adverbs are the work of the devil.
Contact : Sally Williams
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
Community Fun Day on the Yarrowee
Redan Wetlands, Orion Street, Sebastopol
Sun, Jul 20, 2014 10:00 AM - Sun, Jul 20, 2014 01:00 PM
Community Fun Day at Redan Wetlands (Orion St, Sebastopol) on Sunday 20th July, 10am – 1pm. The day includes interactive displays on Ballarat’s wildlife and flora. Stormwater and Water Watch displays, listen to talks on the history of the Yarrowee River.

Help us clean-up Ballarat’s favourite river, hand in a bag of rubbish for entry into our free raffle. Stay for lunch, free hot soup provided. For further information or to RSVP please contact Kate Constance from the Leigh Catchment Group on 0409 585 998 or e-mail: katelcg@iinet.net.au
Contact : Kate Constance
Website Email Tweet Event! 
Fun Day on the Yarrowee River
Redan Wetlands Orion Street, Sebastopol
Sun, Jul 20, 2014 10:00 AM - Sun, Jul 20, 2014 01:00 PM
Community Fun Day at Redan Wetlands Orion St, Sebastopol. 10am – 1pm This day forms part of the ‘Breathing Life Back into the Yarrowee’ project. This project aims to improve the Yarrowee River by undertaking weed control, revegetation, improving facilities and engaging the community on river health issues. Details of the day include:
The community will have the opportunity to clean-up the Yarrowee, by collecting rubbish around the Redan Wetlands. Participants will go into the draw to win a prize pack. There will be educational displays on waterway health by the Corangamite Catchment Management Authority

Interactive displays by Ray Draper (Ballarat Ecologist) on Ballarat fauna

Free soup will be provided at 12:00 for lunch

Talks by Ballarat Environment Network on the history of the Yarrowee and a talk by the Ballarat Field Naturalists on Ballarat flora. These talks will commence from 12:15 Day closes at 1pm
Contact : Kate Constance
Website Email Tweet Event! 
Bring Him Home - Ballarat
Brown Hill Hall Humffray St North, Ballarat
Sun, Jul 20, 2014 03:00 PM - Sun, Jul 20, 2014 05:00 PM
The Voice Professional presents Jason Wasley "Bring Him Home" An afternoon of classics and favourites, light opera arias, and popular songs from great musicals
Contact : Sharon Hatton
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
Royal South Street Competition
Her Majesty's Theatre 17 Lydiard Street Sth Ballarat
Mon, Jul 28, 2014 12:00 AM - Sun, Nov 2, 2014 11:59 PM
Royal South Street Competitions - 2014
As a well established Australian cultural event, the Royal South Street Competitions run for 14 weeks annually hosting 40,000 onstage appearances. The competitors showcase twelve theatrical disciplines including voice, music, and movement. The Society utilise multiple venues throughout Ballarat, including the historic Her Majesty's Theatre. Come along and be entertained. View daily program information, session times and ticket prices at www.royalsouthstreet.com.au. Come along and be entertained.
Contact : Emma
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event! 
Royal South Street Debating Challenge Cup
Town Hall - Council Chambers Sturt Street Ballarat
Mon, Jul 28, 2014 12:00 AM - Mon, Aug 25, 2014 11:59 PM
When: 28th July – 1st August heats. Semi final 18th August. Finals 25th August.

The Debating Challenge Cup promises to be an exciting part of our program for 2014 with debates being battled out again in the City of Ballarat Council Chambers. Primary and Secondary School aged students will be using their best debating skills to debate interesting topics.

The grand final debates promise some fantastic debates which can be enjoyed by audiences of all ages. View daily program information, session times and ticket prices at www.royalsouthstreet.com.au
Come along and be entertained.
Contact : Emma
Visit Facebook Page Website Email Tweet Event!

Display All Events Arts, Culture & Heritage Awards Business Event Children's Events Community Events Environmental Consultations & Forums Festivals Food & Wine International Events Markets & Fairs National Events Special Events Sport

 


 Annual Events

  • ANZAC Day

    Thousands of Australians pay their respects at the many ANZAC Day services held across the nation. Ballarat offers a series of Commemorative Services.
  • School Holidays

    Get on board for School Holiday programs – get in fast to book your space
  • Mars Cycling Australia Road Championships

    The Road National Championships, which are held in January, feature three major disciplines – time trial, criterium and road race
  • Australia Day

    It’s un-Australian to be a Ballarat resident and not visit Lake Wendouree on Australia Day.
  • Begonia Festival

    The Ballarat Begonia Festival is a significant and historic major event for Ballarat and has been held every year since 1953.
  • White Ribbon Day

    The White Ribbon campaign is the largest effort in the world of men working to end violence against women
  • Summer Sundays

    Pack a picnic and enjoy summer in Ballarat’s Botanical Gardens at Council’s free music event.
  • Harmony Fest

    Harmony Fest 2014 is presented and produced by the City of Ballarat (CoB) and the Chinese Australian Cultural Society Ballarat
  • Head of The Lake

    The Head of the Lake is a feature event on the Ballarat schools rowing calendar
  • Christmas in Ballarat

    The festive season comes alive in Ballarat with spectacular Christmas topiary displays and colourful decorations along the Sturt Street gardens.
  • Childrens Week

    Childrens Week 2013 childrens week children kids week
  • Heritage Weekend

    Ballarat Heritage Weekend provides an opportunity for our community to celebrate the city’s rich cultural heritage
  • Meet the Neighbourhood

  • Seniors Week

  • Backyard Tasters

    Come and join 18 fabulous musical groups over 5 evenings at the 2014 Ballarat Backyard Tasters

 

and there's more...
